subproject.corporate outcome: Policies, strategies and partnerships established to enhance public-private sector collaboration and private sector and market development that benefit the poor and ensure that low-income households and small enterprises have access to a broad range of financial and legal services
subproject.description:
The project aims to accomplish provision of financial services to the vulnerable people in three regions of Georgia; Shida Kartli, Mtskheta Mtianeti and Samegrelo and further capacity development of micro businesses. Micro finance institutions will be selected for provision of micro credit while selected Business Advisory Centres will provide capacity development for micro businesses. This two-tier approach will increase access of micro businesses to finance and ultimately have a positive developmental impact on the targeted vulnerable population in the regions. 
Furthermore the project will ensure transparent and conditional provision of grants to the MFIs and closely monitor implementation to ensure the targeted clients are served.  
The project is 100% funded by European Commission and implemented by UNDP.
subproject.title: Microfinance
